body_html:
Have you skipped this part in the README:

REM As for CUDA 8, VS2015 Update 2 or up is required to build PyTorch. Use the following two lines.
set "PREBUILD_COMMAND=%VS140COMNTOOLS%\..\..\VC\vcvarsall.bat"
set PREBUILD_COMMAND_ARGS=x64

Although it is a bit confusing, it doesn't mean you can build using MSVC 2017.
body_text:
Have you skipped this part in the README:
REM As for CUDA 8, VS2015 Update 2 or up is required to build PyTorch. Use the following two lines.
set "PREBUILD_COMMAND=%VS140COMNTOOLS%\..\..\VC\vcvarsall.bat"
set PREBUILD_COMMAND_ARGS=x64
Although it is a bit confusing, it doesn't mean you can build using MSVC 2017.
body:
Have you skipped this part in the README:
```cmd
REM As for CUDA 8, VS2015 Update 2 or up is required to build PyTorch. Use the following two lines.
set "PREBUILD_COMMAND=%VS140COMNTOOLS%\..\..\VC\vcvarsall.bat"
set PREBUILD_COMMAND_ARGS=x64
```
Although it is a bit confusing, it doesn't mean you can build using MSVC 2017.
